text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that goods from third countries to Northern Ireland, if they are flowing to the EU, are subject to the EU tariff rate (and are considered red lane). The candidate answer addresses this in Section 5, stating: 'If they are not clearly confined to NI use/consumption (or the trader isn\u2019t authorised / can\u2019t satisfy conditions), they will face red-lane style requirements and potentially EU duty (depending on the tariff differential and the at-risk rules).' This confirms that goods from third countries (like China) that are not proven to be staying in NI are subject to the EU tariff regime (Red Lane logic).", "criterion_id": "f57b3384-02c0-47f0-b614-11a03bd257cb"}
